1#ifndef UVW_TCP_INCLUDE_H
2#define UVW_TCP_INCLUDE_H
3
4
5#include <type_traits>
6#include <utility>
7#include <memory>
8#include <string>
9#include <chrono>
10#include <uv.h>
11#include "request.hpp"
12#include "stream.h"
13#include "util.h"
14
15
16namespace uvw {
17
18
19namespace details {
20
21
22enum class UVTCPFlags: std::underlying_type_t<uv_tcp_flags> {
23 IPV6ONLY = UV_TCP_IPV6ONLY
24};
25
26
27}
28
29
30/**
31 * @brief The TCPHandle handle.
32 *
33 * TCP handles are used to represent both TCP streams and servers.<br/>
34 * By default, _IPv4_ is used as a template parameter. The handle already
35 * supports _IPv6_ out-of-the-box by using `uvw::IPv6`.
36 *
37 * To create a `TCPHandle` through a `Loop`, arguments follow:
38 *
39 * * An optional integer value that indicates the flags used to initialize
40 * the socket.
41 *
42 * See the official
43 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/tcp.html#c.uv_tcp_init_ex)
44 * for further details.
45 */
46class TCPHandle final: public StreamHandle<TCPHandle, uv_tcp_t> {
47public:
48 using Time = std::chrono::duration<unsigned int>;
49 using Bind = details::UVTCPFlags;
50 using IPv4 = uvw::IPv4;
51 using IPv6 = uvw::IPv6;
52
53 explicit TCPHandle(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref, unsigned int f = {});
54
55 /**
56 * @brief Initializes the handle. No socket is created as of yet.
57 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
58 */
59 bool init();
60
61 /**
62 * @brief Opens an existing file descriptor or SOCKET as a TCP handle.
63 *
64 * The passed file descriptor or SOCKET is not checked for its type, but
65 * it’s required that it represents a valid stream socket.
66 *
67 * @param socket A valid socket handle (either a file descriptor or a SOCKET).
68 */
69 void open(OSSocketHandle socket);
70
71 /**
72 * @brief Enables/Disables Nagle’s algorithm.
73 * @param value True to enable it, false otherwise.
74 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
75 */
76 bool noDelay(bool value = false);
77
78 /**
79 * @brief Enables/Disables TCP keep-alive.
80 * @param enable True to enable it, false otherwise.
81 * @param time Initial delay in seconds (use
82 * `std::chrono::duration<unsigned int>`).
83 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
84 */
85 bool keepAlive(bool enable = false, Time time = Time{0});
86
87 /**
88 * @brief Enables/Disables simultaneous asynchronous accept requests.
89 *
90 * Enables/Disables simultaneous asynchronous accept requests that are
91 * queued by the operating system when listening for new TCP
92 * connections.<br/>
93 * This setting is used to tune a TCP server for the desired performance.
94 * Having simultaneous accepts can significantly improve the rate of
95 * accepting connections (which is why it is enabled by default) but may
96 * lead to uneven load distribution in multi-process setups.
97 *
98 * @param enable True to enable it, false otherwise.
99 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
100 */
101 bool simultaneousAccepts(bool enable = true);
102
103 /**
104 * @brief Binds the handle to an address and port.
105 *
106 * A successful call to this function does not guarantee that the call to
107 * `listen()` or `connect()` will work properly.<br/>
108 * ErrorEvent events can be emitted because of either this function or the
109 * ones mentioned above.
110 *
111 * Available flags are:
112 *
113 * * `TCPHandle::Bind::IPV6ONLY`: it disables dual-stack support and only
114 * IPv6 is used.
115 *
116 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
117 * @param opts Optional additional flags.
118 */
119 void bind(const sockaddr &addr, Flags<Bind> opts = Flags<Bind>{});
120
121 /**
122 * @brief Binds the handle to an address and port.
123 *
124 * A successful call to this function does not guarantee that the call to
125 * `listen()` or `connect()` will work properly.<br/>
126 * ErrorEvent events can be emitted because of either this function or the
127 * ones mentioned above.
128 *
129 * Available flags are:
130 *
131 * * `TCPHandle::Bind::IPV6ONLY`: it disables dual-stack support and only
132 * IPv6 is used.
133 *
134 * @param ip The address to which to bind.
135 * @param port The port to which to bind.
136 * @param opts Optional additional flags.
137 */
138 template<typename I = IPv4>
139 void bind(std::string ip, unsigned int port, Flags<Bind> opts = Flags<Bind>{});
140
141 /**
142 * @brief Binds the handle to an address and port.
143 *
144 * A successful call to this function does not guarantee that the call to
145 * `listen()` or `connect()` will work properly.<br/>
146 * ErrorEvent events can be emitted because of either this function or the
147 * ones mentioned above.
148 *
149 * Available flags are:
150 *
151 * * `TCPHandle::Bind::IPV6ONLY`: it disables dual-stack support and only
152 * IPv6 is used.
153 *
154 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
155 * @param opts Optional additional flags.
156 */
157 template<typename I = IPv4>
158 void bind(Addr addr, Flags<Bind> opts = Flags<Bind>{});
159
160 /**
161 * @brief Gets the current address to which the handle is bound.
162 * @return A valid instance of Addr, an empty one in case of errors.
163 */
164 template<typename I = IPv4>
165 Addr sock() const noexcept;
166
167 /**
168 * @brief Gets the address of the peer connected to the handle.
169 * @return A valid instance of Addr, an empty one in case of errors.
170 */
171 template<typename I = IPv4>
172 Addr peer() const noexcept;
173
174 /**
175 * @brief Establishes an IPv4 or IPv6 TCP connection.
176 *
177 * On Windows if the addr is initialized to point to an unspecified address
178 * (`0.0.0.0` or `::`) it will be changed to point to localhost. This is
179 * done to match the behavior of Linux systems.
180 *
181 * A ConnectEvent event is emitted when the connection has been
182 * established.<br/>
183 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors during the connection.
184 *
185 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
186 */
187 void connect(const sockaddr &addr);
188
189 /**
190 * @brief Establishes an IPv4 or IPv6 TCP connection.
191 *
192 * A ConnectEvent event is emitted when the connection has been
193 * established.<br/>
194 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors during the connection.
195 *
196 * @param ip The address to which to bind.
197 * @param port The port to which to bind.
198 */
199 template<typename I = IPv4>
200 void connect(std::string ip, unsigned int port);
201
202 /**
203 * @brief Establishes an IPv4 or IPv6 TCP connection.
204 *
205 * A ConnectEvent event is emitted when the connection has been
206 * established.<br/>
207 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors during the connection.
208 *
209 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
210 */
211 template<typename I = IPv4>
212 void connect(Addr addr);
213
214 /**
215 * @brief Resets a TCP connection by sending a RST packet.
216 *
217 * This is accomplished by setting the `SO_LINGER` socket option with a
218 * linger interval of zero and then calling `close`.<br/>
219 * Due to some platform inconsistencies, mixing of `shutdown` and
220 * `closeReset` calls is not allowed.
221 *
222 * A CloseEvent event is emitted when the connection has been reset.<br/>
223 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors.
224 */
225 void closeReset();
226
227private:
228 enum { DEFAULT, FLAGS } tag;
229 unsigned int flags;
230};
231
232
233/**
234 * @cond TURN_OFF_DOXYGEN
235 * Internal details not to be documented.
236 */
237
238
239// (extern) explicit instantiations
240
241extern template void TCPHandle::bind<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int, Flags<Bind>);
242extern template void TCPHandle::bind<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int, Flags<Bind>);
243
244extern template void TCPHandle::bind<IPv4>(Addr, Flags<Bind>);
245extern template void TCPHandle::bind<IPv6>(Addr, Flags<Bind>);
246
247extern template Addr TCPHandle::sock<IPv4>() const noexcept;
248extern template Addr TCPHandle::sock<IPv6>() const noexcept;
249
250extern template Addr TCPHandle::peer<IPv4>() const noexcept;
251extern template Addr TCPHandle::peer<IPv6>() const noexcept;
252
253extern template void TCPHandle::connect<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int);
254extern template void TCPHandle::connect<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int);
255
256extern template void TCPHandle::connect<IPv4>(Addr addr);
257extern template void TCPHandle::connect<IPv6>(Addr addr);
258
259
260/**
261 * Internal details not to be documented.
262 * @endcond
263 */
264
265
266}
267

270#include "tcp.cpp"
271#endif
